definition: to say everything (that is on one's mind)
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
variant of 訴|诉[su4]
to complain/to sue/to tell

sentences.english: But I do encourage you during that phrase, you need someone to talk to.
sentences.chinese: 不过我鼓励你们在那个阶段中，需要找个人倾诉一下。

sentences.english: e.g: She poured out her troubles to me over a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她边喝咖啡边向我倾诉她的苦恼。

sentences.english: Now, let us listen to these their confiding .
sentences.chinese: 且让我们先来听听这些朋友的倾诉吧。

sentences.english: Pour DRAMBUIE over shaved ice in a rocks glass.
sentences.chinese: 倾诉drambuie超过削发冰在一个岩石的玻璃。

sentences.english: He poured out his complaints before me.
Bcause I wanted to be a quiet listener when you wanted to spill your guts.
sentences.chinese: 因为我想在你想倾诉的时候做一个安静的聆听者。

sentences.english: Nor ought I to cease for an Instant to lavIsh upon her all that whIch she would dIsdaIn.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她趾高气扬，我也不应当停止向她倾诉衷肠。

sentences.english: We tell river all our secrets.
sentences.chinese: 我们向那条河倾诉我们的秘密。

sentences.english: My moon, my midnight, my talk, my son.
sentences.chinese: 他是我的月亮和午夜，我的儿郎我的倾诉衷肠。

sentences.english: Trees are the earth’s endless effort to speak to the listening heaven.
sentences.chinese: 森林是大地对谛听的天宇无休止的倾诉。

sentences.english: Hello, darkness, my old friend, I've come to talk with you again.
sentences.chinese: 黑夜你好，我的老友，我又来和你倾诉衷肠。

sentences.english: Saori was the only friend Mayo could really tell anything to.
sentences.chinese: 纱织是真夜唯一的可以向之倾诉一切的朋友。

sentences.english: Share your unhappiness with your manager only.
sentences.chinese: 只向你的经理倾诉你的不满。

sentences.english: The more people trust you, the more they will confide in you.
sentences.chinese: 人们越信任你，就越会向你倾诉他们的心事。

sentences.english: She poured out her worries to her best friend.

definition: to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
to pour out (emotions)/to unburden oneself (of strong feelings)/to vomit comprehensively
to pour forth (one's opinions)
to get sth off one's chest
to mediate/to reconcile/to make peace/to intervene
a load on one's mind/worry/CL:宗[zong1],樁|桩[zhuang1]
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of
to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
(to express one's) true feelings/what is on one's mind/secret mind
depressed/dejected/feeling low
to drain (by leading off water)/to unburden oneself/to divulge/to leak a secret
to confide in each other (idiom)
to have a heart-to-heart chat
to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
to listen attentively
to tell/to disclose/to reveal
